intro: Tarenna roseicosta, commonly known as the pink-stemmed tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, orange-red berries. Tarenna roseicosta is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
